Description: Body sherd of Chian, probably black-figured Komast pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; from top, small added white circle with added red centre; zigzag pattern between pairs of white bands; vertical stroke pattern; two further white bands; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of leg and foot of komast moving to left and advanced foot of another komast moving left (possibly a trace of his other leg on the far right); below in handle zone, two brown bands above guilloche pattern.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in Group C of the Black Figure Komast Chalices, which unlike others is not a coherent group. This specific sherd, however, does not have a rim pattern like the rest, while filling ornament is absent and incision is very carefully and delicately executed. According to Williams, it is possible that female dancers are depicted.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 170, p. 327, no. 1520, pl. 197)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p.162 note 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1272) (phase 2)
